column2: II3}}</ref> The house is said to have been located between the [[Carrock]] and the [[Old Forest Road]], on the western borders of [[Mirkwood]]<ref>{{UT
column3: Istari}}, Note 4</ref> and near its southern borders.<ref>{{H
column5: MII}}, p.305</ref><ref group=note>This location for Rhosgobel appears on the first map of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' in ''[[The Treason of Isengard]]''. A dot and the name are near the center of square L-13 on Map II, placing Rhosgobel east and a little south of the [[Gladden Fields]].</ref>

column1: After the [[Council of Elrond]], some scouts from [[Rivendell]] passed over the [[Misty Mountains]] and eventually came to Rhosgobel, but they found that Radagast was not there.<ref>{{FR

column2: UI}}, p. 241</ref> is evidently a compound of ''[[rhosc]]'' ("brown") and ''[[gobel]]'' ("walled house or village, town").<ref>{{LR
column9: accessed=9 April 2012}}</ref> The name of the house was perhaps a reference to its resident, the Brown Wizard.

column1: : A layout, and a detailed description, is given of Rhosgobel. It is built around a large furry oak tree.<ref>{{ICE
'''2011: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game]]'':'''
: Rhosgobel is depicted as a u-shaped wooden house nestled in the woods surrounding a small blue pool of water or pond.<ref>{{webcite
: Rhosgobel appears in a single scene, when it is attacked by [[spiders]]. Radagast later discovers that these spiders came from [[Dol Guldur]].
'''2014: ''[[The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies]]'':'''
: Rhosgobel appears in a single scene, when [[Radagast]] takes [[Gandalf]] from [[Dol Guldur]] to Rhosgobel after alerting the [[White Council]] to his presence there.
